text: 16oz can pours a hazy brown color with a bit of head. Perfect balance if hops and malt. Full maltiness expected from an amber ale.

Can at home. Dark hazy amber with a good off white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical, pine and some sweet caramel. Taste follows the aroma. Im not a big fan of ambers, but this one is absolute one of the best Ive tasted so far.

Canned (10/21/16). Murky amber/orange, foamy offwhite head. Aromas of floral hops, tropical fruits, caramel. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Strong toated flavors into a dry hoppy finish.

Can, 1 pint. A cloudy amber beer with a medium size white head. Hoppy floral aromas with earthly hints. Taste is bitter with some sweetness. Medium bodied with a malt character. Smooth with fizzy carbonation and with an astrigent and somewhat dry finish.

Canned 10/21/16, drunk 11/5/16.Moderately hazy amber body though not intensely soupy or anything. Off-white, small head with moderate retention.Wonderful IPA-like Tree House treatment in the nose full of watermelon, lime and even some sprucy, spicy pine notes. Juicy, of course and clean with strong minerality and no alcohol or flaw.In the mouth its full of the strong watermelon juiciness. Light lemon-lime-like acidity easily balances things and the texture is very soft, with faint caramel-like sweetness and a bit of graininess/breadiness. Engaging carbonation, strong attenuation and no alcohol or flaw with a touch of lingering sticky caramel and long citrus and juice notes.

Pours a dark copper with a medium-large head. Nose is of crackers, pennies (metal), light vanilla and sweet biscuit. Mouth is surprisingly full of overripe peaches and other ripe sweet orchard fruits. Some nice malt carrying through, light bitterness on the finish. Soft mouth feel, always a major strength of this brewery. A bit too much sweetness through the back palate though -- would have liked to see more aggressive hops.

[Notes from 9/6/14] 750mL growler. Pours a red amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is floral, fruity, and with lots of sweet malt. Taste is predominantly caramel with some citrus, berries, bread, and too much pine. Too sweet. Negligible bitterness. Medium body. Prickly carbonation.

[ bottle ][ 1.5oz ][ @Tasting ][ $? ][ schnapps snifter ][ 03.05.15 ]
hazy amber, thin cream head with good lacing. Light manure in generally sweet nose, some grass, earthy hop. Flavor dryer, floral up front with papery mid palate an light grass and pine through the soapy end. Very dry, faint melon rind hiding throughout. Pleasant, simple.
Can. Pours amber brown hazy. Aroma is sweet citrus. Taste is sweet with a little bitterness bready with a caramel sweet finish. Pretty good.

Pounder->English pint. Purchased from some chicks trunk in a beer store parking lot. Because of course. Murky chestnut brown with moderate lite tan head. A: malt, rye, hops, spice. Subdued. Really well balanced. T: spice, slightly dank hops, earth. A little odd taste, but good.

Can at the March DC Tasting, shared by DCLawyer. Thanks! Poured an amber color with a small white head. Aroma was light citrus, creamy malt notes. Flavor was light sweet malts, light floral and herbal character.

Can at the DC March Tasting, shared by DCLawyer. Thanks for pulling this out of some chicks trunk, Jason! Cloudy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, garlic, onion, tropical fruit. Tastes of citrus, floral, pine, garlic, onion, tropical fruit. Medium body with a dry finish. More like an IPA to me.
Some fresh citrus hops and some decent malt presence. Light rust. Pours amber with ok head. Light bitter finish. Can thanks to dclawyer.
Can. Cloudy, almost murky reddish amber color. Aroma of fruity, herbal berries. Taste is bittersweet berries. Decent.

Hazy dark amber body, medium sized off-white head, and soapy lacing. Light toffee, caramel, earth, pine, grapefruit, florals. Medium bodied, semi-dry throughout, moderate carbonation, lingering bitterness.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Thanks to the Scopester. Very hazy amber beer, small cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry. Good fine carbonation. Nice light malts, touch of caramel. Mild orange and decent pine which turns spicy. Trace of marmalade. Semi dry finish. Very nice.

Can. Pours quite cloudy Ruddy chestnut, medium beige head, nice lacing. Aroma is armpits, caramel, lounge, perfume, dank hops. Flavor is medium sweet, light plus bitter, dank and juicy with a solid malt backbone. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Red IPA done right.

Bottle share on the 42nd floor, Canary Wharf tasting. Thanks to Paul!  Murky dark orange / brown, small foamy tan head, light lacing. Aroma is Starburst sweets, herbal, passionfruit, spoiled banana and polish. Nice. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is chalky, pine, mint with a toffee backbone. Dry finish. Decent. Was maybe expecting a bit more from the flavour.
Pours a murky reddish tea brown. The aroma is pine, citrus, grapefruit with a caramel finish. The flavor is mostly bitter, but finishes moderately sweet.

Growler split at the 42nd floor Tasting, thanks to Paulo, 08/10/15.
Hazed amber orange topped with a decent beige swirl. 
Nose is light kerosene akin to an aeroflot engineers overalls, bitter orange, earthy hop, caramel, pine.
Taste comprises melon, orange pith, light spice, straw, caramel. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with earthy hop bitterness. 
Solid hoppy amber.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler via trade shared at the 42nd floor tasting. It pours murky deep reddish-amber with a thick yellow-white head. The nose is fresh, piney, resin, varnish, light spice, varnish, touch of dried berry and caramel. The taste is crisp, clean, bitter, varnish, pine, light alcohol boost, some caramel, mild hop astringency, grapefruit and resin with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Well-rounded and highly drinkable. Didnt quite blow my socks off, but I enjoyed it nonetheless.

Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Thanks to Paul. Hazed reddy amber coloured pour with a loose creamy head. Aroma is diesel, happy citrus, brown bread crusts. Flavour is composed of, nutty, brown malt, citrus, leafy, diesel. Palate is medium, full, little sticky, highish carbonation. Good stuff.

75cl bottle at the 42nd level tasting, London. Big thanks to Paul for this bad boy. It pours a cloudy amber color with a medium beige head. Aroma is light with mostly citrus and caramel. Taste is much more intense and full, with notes of citrus, grapefruit, sweet apricots. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, very tasty

Growler shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours clear amber-gold with a frothy off-white head. Nicely rounded aroma, lightly toasted bread, pine, orange. Medium sweet flavor with sturdy piney bitterness, ripe citrus, gooey berries. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Bitter and resinous on the finish, some further toasty malts, pine, light grass. Great stuff. Very well rounded.
Can thanks to Rainer. Pours a hazy copper with small off white head. The aroma is strong tropical fruit, pineapple and citrus. Medium mouth, grass, pine, dank, juicy hop, very nice.

Aroma of toffee, hard rye bread, with spicy and grapefruit hop notes. Taste is quite dry, but a nice toffee and biscuity background and a very pleasant big but soft hop flavor. Probably as good as an Amber ale gets.

Cloudy reddish-Brown with thin rimming beige head; aroma us rich hoppy spice cedars wood and malt backbone; flava is rich caramel malty tangy with hop spice; feels medium with nice fizzy foaminess; finishes dry bitter tangy malt notes

Initially, I was very disappointed since I only got this growler fill after I found out that Curiosity 17 had just kicked. However this proved to be serendipity. Amber ales dont garner a lot of attention, but this one is really well done. Fresh, bitter piney hops come thing above a really well balanced bready/toffee thing going on with the malt base. Paired it up with some awesome BQQ... Perfection.

Pours a glowing amber color with two finger of eggshell foam. Lots of citrus, pine, toasted malt and layers of fruit. Fuji apple, bosc pear, candied orange. Malt profile is solid with hint of earthy spice lots of toasted rustic notes and a long lingering finish.

Growler shared by a friend. Clear red pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of malt, grassy hop and light citrus. Malty flavor with sweet caramel accents before a grassy and grapefruit hop finish. Very nice amber.

Poured from growler into reservoir tip glass. Pours amber with a thin white head. Aroma of citrus, dough, caramel, and sugar. Taste is nicely balanced between the malts and a little hop at the back end. Lots of bread and caramel. Medium body, nice beer.
Growler in line for Sourd in September. Pours amber. Nose/taste of maple syrup, resin, citrus, molasses and caramel. Medium body.

750ml growler in a tulip. Pours deep amber almost brown with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of light floral and lightly citrusy hops, a lot of caramel and toffee and pale malts, and dough. Flavor way too malty. Average texture. A decent beer but not my favorite.
growler, a great amber, light to moderate sweetness inthe body, some complex citrus hop aroma, moderate to lgiht bitterness, great stuff.
Nice amber that pours a really nice amber red color with off whit head. Aroma is pear, citrus, grass, bread, and caramel. Taste is moderate sweetness and buttering hops. Good amber.

A: Deep Amber/Mild Brownish Hue, Passes Mild Light, White Head, Some Lacing 

S: Grainy Malts, Mild Citrus, Mild Bittering Hops 

T: Grainy Malts, Mildly Floral, Mild Citrus, Mild Bittering Hops 

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter 

Overall, a very nice bitter amber ale with nice balance of hops and malts.
